meanings.definition: A strap on a saddle used to secure the cinch or girth.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy tightened the latigo to keep the saddle in place.
meanings.sent2: She checked the latigo before mounting the horse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous horse tried to chew on the latigo, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The latigo was the lifeline that kept the saddle from slipping during the ride.
meanings.sent5: The worn latigo showed the many adventures it had been on.

meanings.definition: A type of leather used for making straps or belts.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman selected the finest latigo for the belt he was making.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite purse was made of soft latigo leather.
meanings.sent3: The latigo leather had a rich aroma that filled the workshop.
meanings.sent4: His latigo belt was a symbol of his craftsmanship and attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The latigo strap was supple yet durable, perfect for daily use.
